Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Paula B
Reviews.Content: Our family of four loved this hotel. Cappuccino was the best we had, there was a computer for us to use in the beautiful lobby, our rooms were wonderful and the location was within walking distance of EVERYTHING. In fact, the little neighborhood it is in has everything. One of the best bites of pizza came from the nearby bakery.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Marlene S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 3 nights, the hotel is centrally located and you can easily walk to all the tourist sites. There is no Wi-Fi in the room and only one computer available off the lobby. The staff was friendly above all Guiseppe who was very patient and helpful...The breakfast was a traditional European type with a few bread stuffs, cereal, eggs, juice and coffee. Our room was very small , and the shower/bathroom much smaller and we didn't know where put our bags but this hotel was adequate in being clean and quiet in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Julie”
Reviews.Author: Julie W
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in a superb location. The room was lovely with a balcony and staff who will go out of their way to help. I would defiantly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy064
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Due Torri was perfect for our three-day trip to Rome - the location is amazing. We got a lovely room with a balcony and the hotel is so quiet, despite being in the heart of the city. Breakfast is nice - the coffee is brilliant! Very friendly service too. The rooms are small but there is everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quiet Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BuzzN
Reviews.Content: Hotel Due Torri is a great hotel in a very quiet neighborhood in central Rome (Pantheon area). It is easy to find and within walking distance of the Spagna metro stop. The street is very small so there is almost no traffic or other noise. The staff is very friendly, helpful and accommodating. We had a two room "suite" on an upper floor, which overlooked the tiled rooftops of this delightful neighborhood. The lobby, lounge and breakfast room were beautiful and very comfortable. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quaint and quiet central in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just what I was hoping for”
Reviews.Author: Holls13
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The staff were all amazing and were very helpful. It was my first time ever leaving the country and I was solo. The location was great and I felt there were plenty of signs to lead me back when I wondered around Rome. The room was small, but that was to be expected. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: albo_on_the_move
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! I stayed here with my friend and we both found the front desk staff super helpful and the breakfast great (especially the coffee with steamed milk - yum)! It was a bit of a splurge for us but we found it to be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the locstion”
Reviews.Author: Maryevelyn
Reviews.Content: The selling point is the location -- it just doesn't get more convenient. Although clean, the place is in need of renovation as everything seems worn and tired, and, as a result, it's a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingJulianne
Reviews.Content: Hotel Due Torri is located on a quiet lane in a fabulous location -- easy walking distance to the Pantheon, Plaza Navona, the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The staff (expecially Laura) is helpful and friendly, the breakfast is delicious with marvelous cappicino, and the view from the small balcony is pure Rome. The rooms are a bit dated, but clean and functional. There is only one laptop to use in the lobby, but the public rooms are lovely. For anyone who loves Rome but finds the city a bit overwhelming, Hotel Due Torri is an oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Italian Charm & Kids Welcome!”
Reviews.Author: MoeFamily
Reviews.Content: We were referred to the Hotel Due Torri by some friends and we loved it. It's super charming, the breakfast hearty with some of the best pastries we've eaten and we're currently living in Paris so that says a lot, and most importantly, the staff was incredibly friendly and welcoming to our three children. The location is super central as well. We stayed there on two separate occasions in August and both times were just a friendly as the other.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jasarah
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel in a great location was just what we wanted. Small and comfortable, great breakfast (not true everywhere in Italy), but above all, the staff was fabulous. The people at the front desk saw it as their job to help you find everything you needed to have a great visit, from a good haircut, to a place to do laps in a pool, to great restaurants. We couldn't have been more pleased. Great value, a rare thing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ALaugh
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is near the Pantheon, and also close to the river and an easy 20 minute walk to Vatican City. The staff at the hotel were incredibly helpful, nice, and accommodating. Our rooms were on the fifth floor, and since the elevator only goes to the 4th floor, they kindly took our bags up for us so we didn't have to carry them up an extra floor. The hotel was very quiet and quaint, with a nice breakfast. As is typical in Europe, the rooms were on the small side, but we have absolutely no complaints and would return to this hotel again if we come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MElchinoff
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 teenage children stayed here for 3 nights. A great location, walking distance to the Vatican and and most important sites. Rome is a city to be walked. Bus stops are very close. Very clean. Modern bathroom. Rooms and bathroom a bit small, but normal for Europe and this style of hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Mnay good reasonably priced restaurants nearby. The only real negative is that you can only access the wireless internet in the lobby. I would highly recommend. It is not a Sheraton, so don't expect it to be like a American hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: jwillstp
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the location of this hotel. Each person at the front desk during our stay was very helpful and made excellent dining recommendations. The included breakfast was very good. The room was a little cramped but adequate and clean. The bathroom was also cramped but adequate. The shower was the smallest I have been in in Europe. A larger person would not be able to even close the shower door. The only warning I would give is that the outside noise is bothersome at night. The windows do not do anything to block the sound. There is a very large guard dog for the business next door, and he does bark at night and it woke me up a number of times. Our room was a corner room on the first floor right above the reception area. Wireless internet worked well in the lobby but not in our room. Knowing this, I would still stay here again based on location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location; awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: JanetLR
Reviews.Content: Hotel Due Torri is in an excellent location in Rome--very near to the Piazza Navona, and within walking distance of many sites, depending on how much you like to walk (I do), including the Parthenon, the Vatican, etc. It's tucked away in an alley, and was, in general, very quiet at night. We did have one night of action and sirens in the alley, so bring your earplugs. The hotel set it up so that three of us could stay in one room--although this was cozy, it allowed us to save some money. Room and bathroom are modern and clean. The continental breakfast was wonderful, and the staff were, all of them, friendly, helpful, and there to be of service. Great place, I would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent vacation”
Reviews.Author: mli_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel We Liked The Hotel Very Much We reached This Hotel After We Did Not Liked The Apartment That We Ordered. We Met At The Reception Cintizia, She Did Everything To Help Us. We Were There With Three Children After Long Flight... She Found For Us Two Rooms Very Nice Rooms Clean And Cosy We Will Never Forget This Hotel. The Hotel is in the center Near The Pantheon, Piazza Navona And The Metro although It Was Very Quiet. We Will Be Back For Sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 22skiing
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights end of March having booked direct on hotel's website following recommendation by a colleague. At time of booking we requested a top floor room with terrace. Were advised that our request could not be guaranteed as rooms are allocated on a first come-first-serve basis and that these rooms are smaller. However, our request was met and we were allocated room 503 - with small terrace (big enough for small table and two chairs) overlooking nearby rooftops and beyond. The room was small but perfectly adequate and very clean. Bathroom also very small (no bath just shower, which we prefer - but with proper shower door!) but, again, very clean. There were some toiletries provided but, as we always take our own, I'm not sure what they were although I think there was shampoo and shower gel, soap of course (and shower cap). Hotel due Torri is located in the historic centre of Rome within easy walking distance of all the main tourist sites and plenty of restaurants. As soon as we arrived we were handed a very useful tourist map with the hotel's location marked and tourist sites pointed out by the Receptionist. We had done our homework before travelling, so were pretty confident of what we wanted to see and where to find it but you only had to ask the staff if you had any questions, they were always very helpful and obliging. On our first evening we asked at Reception if they could recommend a local restaurant and we were given the name and address of a small simple restaurant (Marco & Gloria) just minutes way. The food was excellent although we were a bit thrown by the staff's lack of English (but, hey, we were in Rome and didn't speak much Italian!) but we got by. Unfortunately, as we like to eat fairly early the dining room was deserted except for us, so it was a little lacking in atmosphere and a bit cold. However, having tried the usual tourist fayre on later evenings we would not hesitate to recommend it - it was the best meal we had and at very a reasonable price. There is no restaurant or bar at Hotel due Torri but, as mentioned, there are all types of restaurants, bars etc. nearby. The small breakfast room is very pleasant, and offers a basic breakfast - cereals, pastries, toast, preserves, boiled eggs, tea/coffee, juice (but not a "cooked" breakfast) and some fresh fruit. The lady in charge here is very helpful. I don't drink tea or coffee and asked on the first morning it they had peppermint tea. They had green tea, and a few other herbal varieties but not peppermint. However, it wasn't a problem - I went to the local Spa supermarket and bought some. But on day two, the breakfast lady (sorry, I don't know her name) had got some peppermint tea for me - brilliant! All in all, our stay at Hotel due Torri was extremely pleasant. We would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: twosteen
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome, so I don't have anything to compare to, but we enjoyed the hotel and it's location. About a five minute walk away from the Piazza Navona, fifteen minutes to the Vatican and the Pantheon. Not out of walking distance of anything we wanted to get to. The room was nice-typically European small, but functional. The staff was helpful and friendly. The owner of the hotel made her rounds a few times. Everything was clean and well maintained. My only complaint was the noise from the alley in front of the hotel. The noise from cars and scooters was amplified in the small alley. A big German Shepard (who apparently guards a parking garage across the alley) made his presence felt late at night and early in the morning. A minor annoyance, but still... The high point of the hotel was a recommendation for dinner. "Memmo's was about two minutes away. It looked like a hole in the wall, but was a fantastic experience. We shared a small dining room with a two Spanish couples, an Italian couple and another American family and it was great fun. If you go there, ask to get a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: bcarrie6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Due Torri in March and it was great. I thought the location was perfect, we could walk to all main attractions. THe furtherst walk was to the Collesum and that was about a half hour or less (walking slow), but everythign else was within 15 min. I thought the staff was very helpful and it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: GoldCoastTakingOff
Reviews.Content: I felt very safe and comfortable here. Was a short walk to Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. I caught a taxi from the airport but would not like to be trying to find it on foot. I had asked for a balcony but didn't get one - the room was very small but had all I needed and a view across the roof tops of the beautiful old buildings surrounding the hotel. And lets face it if you're in your room too long why are you in Rome? Reception staff were very helpful and was good value for Rome! Great breakfast. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great position for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: burglarbetty
Reviews.Content: No nonsense - no frills, but the reception staff were extremely helpful. Useful bookshelf of travel guides to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in excellent position”
Reviews.Author: Lyninspain
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is really excellent. Certainly the rooms are small, but what do you expect in Rome for the price? We were given accommodation on the top floor, which meant a small flight of stairs as the lift didn't go all the way up, however it was worth it to have a large private roof terrace - terrific to sip a glass of wine after a hard days sight-seeing, and watch the sun set over the rooftops of the Eternal City. The staff were more than friendly and helpful, breakfast very good. If you go, ask Cynthia about the seagulls with lights on thier wings......

Reviews.Title: “Located in an excellent location near the river and not far from the Spanish steps”
Reviews.Author: vibrantlinda
Reviews.Content: After I wandered around a bit discovered this B & B was in a nice location but without a taxi driver might not been able to find it as easily but it can be done. Near the Pantheon and not far from the Trevi Fountain and of course shopping in some of the high end Italian brand name stores. Lovely dining room and living room and staff very helpful with directions and all arrangements. Single room, unlike doubles, was very small but they had informed me so it wasn't quite as much of a surprise but once I settled in and was gone most of the time it didn't matter. Rome is expensive to stay and a good location is important. Great restaurants all around and of course lots of piazas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value, Getting Here Tip”
Reviews.Author: LettsGo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not one of your large multi-national chains. It offers solid value, clean rooms, good quality beds, and a very nice breakfast to prepare you for sightseeing in Rome. The rooms are clean, not particularly big, but by any standard perfectly adequate. After all, you are in Rome! how much time were you planning to spend in your room anyway? Very close, walking distance to Vatican - 20 minutes, Pantheon 8 minutes, Spanish Steps 15 minutes. Pleasant location, much more quiet and clean than the area around Termini Train Station. Our stay in the hotel was good - the hotel staff offered helpful hints on restaurants nearby. A great base for sightseeing in Rome. To get here, from the airport (Fiumicino) we used the Sitbusshuttle - (sitbusshuttle.it), 8 Euros per person, drops you off at Piazza Cavour, which is an easy 10 minute walk across one of the bridges to the hotel. Much easier, cheaper than other options. Just make sure you do not get diverted at the airport by one of the non-authorized minibuses or taxis that will tell you "shuttle".

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, small room.”
Reviews.Author: hthappiness
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and incredibly helpfully – the best I’ve experienced in any hotel in any country. The hotel is centrally located for the major attractions in Rome. Breakfast was the best we experienced while in Italy – a good variety of items and everything was fresh. We stayed in the “family room” which consists of two rooms. The larger room with queen bed was a good size but the room with 2 twin beds is very small -just enough room for two suitcases. The shower is very small – a larger person could have difficulty using it. The air conditioning kept the rooms comfortably cool even with the 40 degree Celsius outside temperature. Overall a good value. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: titianTitian
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with pleasant and helpful staff. It is in the historic center near several good restaurants. Piazza Navona is very close, several excellent churches and the Pantheon are within easy walking distance. St. Peter's and the Vatican are a longer walk. It is in a narrow alley and is quiet at night. I have stayed here several times. The price is moderate for Rome. No tour groups or buses here. Breakfasts are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Location, fabulous; staff, wonderful and accomodating; rooms, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FargoJena
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. Not fabulous but really nice. It is very clean and airy. the locations was great. The breakfast was good, cappucino excellent. The breakfast staff, wonderful. The best part about it really is the staff, espcially the owner. We were there right after my Mother died, to visit my daughter, who was studing in Rome. Everyone was exceptionally helpful and worked very hard to ensure our stay was delightful, which it was. They gave us suggestions for dinner each night and helped us with directions when we ventured out for the day. Truly a great experience!!!! Thank you to all!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: BiberColumbia_SC
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to major Roma sites. Owner suggested 2 great places to eat, one was for late afternoon snack and the other for dinner. The dinner location was not one that a tourist would pick - we were the rare tourist. Food, service and experience was great. Hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and spoke good English. We had a studio room on the 3rd floor, bedroom, bathroom and extra sitting room. Owner had some nice ammenities - 5X mirror, makeup removal pads and q-tips.

Reviews.Title: “Grazie Hotel Due Torri”
Reviews.Author: NandM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended in my "Little Black Book of Rome" and I followed up with online reviews. We started the trip in a monastery, rented an apartment in Sorrento and ended with Hotel Due Torri in Rome for our final two nights. Keep your eyes open for the small sign, it was easy to overlook. One of my landmarks was finding Piazza Nicosia and then proceeding down Vicolo de Leonetto. Hotel Due Torri was the most expensive of our stays but we agreed to splurge a little on our final two nights. I liked the historic significance of the hotel (which was a former papal residence that has been restored) and the location for seeing the sights of eastern Rome. Our room (101) was comfortable & roomier than expected (especially the bathroom), clean and comfortable with a nice armoire for our things. The view was of the neighboring building and of the handsome German Shepard standing guard over the parking garage next door. There is a charge for tv and internet but we didn't need either. We had a nice breeze at night and a the unobtrusive chatter of the residents across the way was pleasant as I guess I was trying to bottle the sounds of our surroundings to take home as souvenirs. The breakfast was extensive for an inclusionary one. Cappuccino and espresso, spinach quiche, various fruits and breads, yogurt & juice and was set up in a beautiful dining room. Very plush.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, it just didn't make the grade.”
Reviews.Author: Misskitty750
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my mom. 2 other hotels picked from Rick Steves guidebook, with lots of reviews read on tripadvisor, and those hotels were great. This one was really disappointing. Rolling bags through alley to front door. No big deal, we've been rolling our bags all over Italy, but this alley was particularly grimy, and did have a slightly unpleasant smell. Was disturbed to see front door carpet half red, half black with filth. Ugg. Lobby and common areas were really nice, indeed. Breakfast room looked quaint. Got checked in, and up to room. Room was great disappointment. Dark, even with lights on, low ceiling, furniture shabby. Depressing kinda feel to it. Air was actually dank, and not moving or fresh. Window looked out to another window with laundry hanging. Bathroom was worse. Tiny is an understatement. Upon using the toilet, my knee actually hit the bidet which was parked perpendicular to toilet. Went down to lobby to ask if there was any way we could get an upgrade to another room. Was told they were full for the week. Felt panicky sensation now. Walked about 5 minutes to Hotel Nazionale, which had space available, let us see the lovely spacious room with the nice bathroom, and gave us the Rick Steves discount. Back to Due Torri to collect bags and check out. Was told at this point they could put us on the 5th floor in a larger room starting the next night. Told them sorry, we were checking out, and I paid the one night penalty for early check out gladly. This one didn't make my cut, anyway. For $75.00 more per night, the Nazionale was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It worked out for the 3 days we were there. Wouldn't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Mabenlady
Reviews.Content: The front desk was nice. The complimentary breakfast was nice. It was a convenient walk to a lot of attractions, which was a plus. The pillows were hard and the room smelled like someone sprayed a deodorizer or sprinkled that smelly carpet deodorizer in there. Probably to mask a former smoke odor. There was a dog in the alley that barked a lot. It wasn't awful, but it wasn't that great and I wouldn't recommend the place to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Central, neat and off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: LarsDane
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife, when she was expecting. It's a small, very central hotel, where we could easily reack major sights without too much walking - and be able to reach back for a rest during the day (not much of a walker when you're 2 months due...) The room was clean, though small with a nice bathroom. The conciergies (all women) was very helpful and But when youre only staying there for the nights and want something secluded and not facing a big street, this is a fine place. Just near Piazza Navona, Piazza de Spagna, Pantheon, Fontana de Trevi, Basillica de San Pietro, Trastevere and many other places within walking distance, this is very nice. We always like to find somthing off the beaten track - so highly recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and value, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Jayhawk1960
Reviews.Content: Hotel Due Torri is a wonderful gem, tucked into a small sidestreet. We had the family room, with a small separate room for the teen agers. By American standards, all European rooms are small, but these were more than adequate and when in Rome, we were only there for sleeping. Airconditioning was very good, which is critical in summer. Breakfast was very good too, and there are a number of excellent family restaurants steps away (that are affordable too). All of the sites are within 20-30 minutes walking, including Colosseum, Vatican, Spanish Steps, Borghese, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, etc. Noise was never a concern,, even from the sidestreet. Check out the soccer playing German Sheperd Luna at the garage next door. The staff was excellent and attentive. We have stayed in more expensive Rome hotels before, but they didn't offer anything more than Due Torri.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: pandabear50
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome, and I was concerned about a location that was safe, easy to navigate and comfortable. Hotel Due Torri met all our needs and we loved the hotel and will stay there again. The location on the alley is well-lit and close to a main street that leads quickly to the Pantheon and the Piazza Navona. The Vatican and St. Peter's are easy to walk to as well as Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. Even the Coliseum is about 25 minutes walk away. The owner, Cynthia, and staff were very helpful in service, sightseeing suggestions, and reservations and calls for taxi; the breakfast was ample and excellent. We met many interesting people -- Americans, British -- in the breakfast room and got helpful tips in shopping and tourism. The alley provided some quiet, as compared to a hotel in Palermo where the street noise was very loud. Our two-room family room w/bath on 4th floor had ample space with working air conditioning, and the bathroom was clean, well maintained and excellent supplies. We walked to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona in the evening and returned at 11:30 p.m. and felt quite safe. There were many tourists and police in the area as we walked back after enjoying the cafes, the musicians and the fountains at night. Nearby were excellent mom-pop shops with delicious pizza squares and pistachio cookies. We purchased the best olive oil from Sabina and ate sliced sausages from a local shop. The recommended restaurants by the staff were mid to high price range, but terrific cuisine. There are cheaper restaurants close by as well in near the Pantheon. You can not easily find taxis a la NYC so check with the hotel staff. Plus know that the fixed fare from Rome city to airport is 40 euros; the taxi from the train station to hotel was less miles and he charged 40 euros -- too much. But we were so hot and tired that we paid it.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, homey hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: euromerp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Due Torri for 3 nights in May 2009 and, overall, had a very nice stay. The hotel is located on a very quiet street not far from the Piazza Navona. There is a cute street just a block away that has some nice restaurants and popular places like the Spanish Steps are a short walk away. My room was tiny. Now, I am a solo traveler and I know how tiny single rooms in europe can be. And this was by far the smallest one I have ever stayed in. But to be fair, the Hotel told me that the room was quite small when I made my reservation inquiry. Small though it was, they used the space in the room very well. There was a very large double closet with drawers that had room for all my clothes to be unpacked plus storage room for my suitcase. The bathroom was small but the shower was great - nice and hot, with good pressure. They have a nice set up where you can get internet on your TV - 5 euro for 24 hours. Not a bad price at all and it was nice to check my e-mail and such from the comfort of my room. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was a little bit stuffy and I asked about air conditioning, which had not yet been turned on for the season. When I asked if they had a fan, they said yes and it was in my room by the time I returned from my sightseeing. In fact, my only real complaint about the hotel would be that the air conditioning wasn't on yet. Rome can get quite warm in May and if you advertise yourself as having air conditioning, you should have air conditioning. Breakfast was the best of all the hotels I stayed at in Italy - fresh rolls, good cappuccino, juice, fruit and many other options. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel located in historic center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TNLady60
Reviews.Content: Hotel Due Torri was our home base during four days in Rome. Our room was tiny, but had a nice balcony overlooking nearby homes and churches. The charming chiming of church bells was heard from our balcony. The staff was very professional and efficient, spoke excellent English, and answered every question. The breakfast was delicious, offering a variety of fruit, sweet rolls, cereals and breads. The cappuccino was wonderful. Located just blocks from Piazza Narvona and the Pantheon, we walked to all the historic sites in Rome. The electric bus route is one block away and you can catch the little bus to St. Peter's Square and other historic sites. There were shops nearby where we purchased wine, bread, cheese and salami for our afternoon snacks. Excellent restaurants were also within easy walking distance. We highly recommend Hotel Due Torri.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FB-Bear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Due Torri in September 2008 for 2 nights. It is in the middle of the historic district and within walking distance of many restaurants and historic sites. We walked to all the main tourist spots: Vatican (15 min.), Piazza Navona (5 min.), Pantheon (10 min.), Forum & Coliseum (30 min.), Piazza di Spagna (20 min.) The room was small but clean. The bathroom was small but adequate and clean. We had a room on the 5th floor with a terrace and view of the rooftops. The elevator stops at the 4th floor. Easy walk up to the 5th floor. The breakfast was nice and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: settecento
Reviews.Content: Living in Italy, we have occasion to come to Rome every so often but we've never found the perfect hotel until now. The Due Torri is not a four or five star but it is very comfortable and friendly. Then regarding location, it's perfect because my wife and I love the Piazza Navona - Pantheon area and the greenery of the River Tiber walks and the Castel Sant'Angelo. The surrounding neighborhood of the hotel is a maze of narrow cobblestoned streets filled with shops, artesan workshops, and tiny trattorias where you can still find excellent Roman cusine. The Hotel Due Torri is in a building dating from the 16th century. Notwithstanding, it has very nice common areas and a nifty breakfast room. Our room was on the second floor (number 201) which could be easily reached by the elevator or the internal stairway. It was a fairly large room with a very comfortable bed, a dresser, chest, wardrobe and two chairs and a mini bar/safe with a 21 inch flat screen TV on top. The bathroom with tub/shower was also good-sized and relatively new. There was also a small entrance area with another built-in wardrobe. The air conditioning worked fine and could be controlled from the room. However we didn't use it hardly at all because even though it was very hot outside, the room was quite cool. We usually kept the window open (no mosquitos at night!) and were very comfortable. The only window was maybe the negative aspect of the room because it was very old and in dire need of replacement (here a modern double-glazed window would be nice). The view was to the building directly across the alley (about three meters or so) and the windows of that building. Another type of guest would not appreciate the noise from the TV of the apartment across the alley, or the metal shutters of the garage and shops opening in the morning and closing at night; voices of people occasionally passing through the alley, the garage dog that barked some times, etc. For us it was all okay because it's what one should expect living in that area. What would Rome be without a little noise? I noted that the rooms on the first floor had maybe been renovated recently. Plus I was told that the fifth floor rooms have balconies and views but are small in size. Okay, our room cost was 200 euros per night (due to go down to 150 in August I believe). This included a good and very adequate buffet breakfast. I parked our car in the garage (autorimessa) in front of the hotel. It cost me 40 euros a night but leaving a nice car out on the street is not a good idea. The hotel is dog friendly so we were able to keep our little dog in our room and there was no problem walking him in the neighboring streets or along the Tiber (with clean-up bags of course). I should mention that the streets are not super clean in that area! Some trip advisor members staying here have mentioned being afraid at night because of dark streets, but aside from an occasional harmless bum or homeless person or group of drunk tourists wandering around, the area seemed to be perfectly safe even late at night. The hotel owner and staff were all very nice and friendly. I would cite specifically the lady in the breakfast room and the gentleman at the front desk as being great! I think we'll return to the Due Torri for our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Right place, lovely people.”
Reviews.Author: Wingfie
Reviews.Content: The bright smile and charming entrance foyer immediately said "welcome home". The hotel is in a quiet location with easy access to The Pantheon, Piazza Navona etc. Plus decent restaurants around every corner. Our room, clean and cheerful, was of average size for a Rome *** hotel and represented fair value at Euro 200. Breakfast was excellent. Plenty of common area to sit around and read, watch television etc. Would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Not great room”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandFlan
Reviews.Content: This is a tricky review as I liked the hotel and the staff and the location was excellent. You could literally walk to 3/4 of the attractions in Rome and hit the subway for the rest. The hotel was charming, breakfast was great!!! But the room was awful. We were a family of four and expected a tiny, cramped room -- in fact we were warned of it by the hotel. But the rooms were dingy. Not particularly clean, the bathroom was downright dangerous and cheap. The rooms were small but outdated by 30 years with a radio or some contraption in the wall that had to be state of the art in the 50s and should have been removed in the 60s. The side room with two single beds had two windows, but they were looking out into the elevator shaft which was quite noisy. While we spend very little time in our room, it was disappointing. I might go back if it was merely my wife and I. She won't go back and I would never go back with more than two people. However, the staff and location make the hotel worthwhile and it does have lots and lots of charm. The coffee at breakfast, made fresh for you by your waitress, was soo good, I couldn't wait to go to bed at night.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nknyc
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 lovely days at Due Torri and could not have been more pleased. For the money and location, I can't imagine finding a better value. Yes, my single room was small, but for one person it was absolutely fine. There's a roomy closet, a desk, a small flatscreen TV, and even a little step-out balcony. The room was spotless, the bathroom very new, and (ironed!) towels were brought in every day. Within 5 minutes walk you are at the Pantheon. In the other direction, you're at Piazza Navona. Note: do print out a map of their location (on their website) to show your cab driver. The street is small and unknown. ***ALSO, beware of unscrupulous cab drivers in Rome! Make sure they turn on their meters (unless coming from airport, which is a fixed price). I had a driver who didn't turn on his meter, and then tried to charge me 35 Euros for an 8 Euro ride!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Little Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: bnoel
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent 3 wonderful nights at this great hotel where the location, staff, breakfast and everything experienced was extremely good. Attentive staff; great recommendations for restaurants and a location which allowed us to walk to most locations visited. Will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Smart Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BWBT
Reviews.Content: We spent just a couple of nights at this hotel recently and were very pleased with it. The Hotel is on a small street which may not be too easy to find, but the immediate location is very good with shops, cafes and restaurants nearby and its just a short walk to Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. The breakfast room and other public areas are remarkably spacious and comfortable for a hotel of this size and the bedrooms well equipped and nicely decorated. The bed was large and comfortable and the room had plently of storage space plus a well planned bathroom. Reception staff were friendly and efficient and the buffet breakfast very good.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: WarsawWanderer
Reviews.Content: The rave reviews we'd read about this hotel turned out to be overblown. Tho we had presumably one of the best rooms in the hotel (as the hotel was almost empty), it was very small, and the bathroom downright cramped. It DID have a delightful view over the rooftops of Rome (and of a medieval tower off to one side), because it was on the top/4th floor. The vaunted "antique furniture" is more like "old furniture". The brochure says it has been "thoroughly restored", but that must have been years ago, as everything needs "refreshing" and seems tired. The location is indeed great for exploring historic Rome by foot. It is on an a narrow medieval lane (so narrow our taxi from the station wouldn't venture down it, but getting taxis to pick us up there was not a problem) and is in the midst of a maze of similar lanes, so getting to a desired site (e.g. Piazza Navona, the Spanish Steps) is not easy for the geographically-challenged. The staff were pleasant, and for the most part very well informed and helpful. Buffet breakfast was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ltpt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 of our 9 nights. Rome cabs picked us up and didn't have any problems getting to the hotel. I would stay here again. We had a double. Which was VERY small, clean, very quiet. Bathroom was small and we are not little and didn't have a problem. We never heard anyone in the other rooms next to ours and the hotel was sold out. The breakfast was good, lasted us until the afternoon. For the price it was near everywhere we wanted to go. The staff were fine. Never had a problem getting an answer to any questions we had. We thought we would never find our way back everyday but did. Unless your on business who stays in the hotel when they are on vacation. We were out walking 12 hours a day! Again for the price we would highly recommmend this hotel. I think "us" Americans are a little too picky when in a different country.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but not a perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: atl7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location where you can walk to most places within 10- 20 minutes. The staff was not overly friendly and the room had a bad musty smell. We had no problem with noise and as far as locating it - when you get in the general area, just look for the signs on the street indicating the direction of the hotel, otherwise it can be easy to miss. We would probably try to find another hotel in the same neighborhood next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the single room very small, smallest room ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: bjorkebo73
Reviews.Content: The staff was a lite bit sour, did not seem to enjoy work or was really tired. I stayed in a single room and it was the smallest room i ever stayed in, no place where i could have my suitcase fully open only on bed. Bed was comfortable but really tiny can not have been more than 100 cm. Room was clean and breakfast was ok a basic italian breakfast nothing more than that. Location is good close to Piazza Navona and other things is within 20 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ciaoUSA
Reviews.Content: We were booked into tiny room in a hotel out in the Rome 'burbs' [30 min tram ride to the stop near the Pantheon] when we found the Hotel Due Torri. The hotel personnel showed us the room BEFORE we reserved it. Needless to say, we opted to pay HUGE cancellation fee at our hotel to stay at the Hotel Due Torri and never regretted the decision. It's a beautiful hotel in a great location [just a few blocks from the Piazza Navona, around the corner from a great restaurant - L'Orso, and a bridge walk to the Castle of Angels] with an over the top customer service staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: YiannisKavala
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel due Torri during June 2007 for 5 nights on a twin bed room of the top floor . Good news about Due Torri : The Hotel is clean , the stuff is polite and friendly , our room was very quiet , the location is probably one of the best you can get ,the breakfast is good , the Lobby and the breakfast room are charming . Bad news about Due Torri : The place is overpriced !! The tired condition ,the small size and the warn out furniture of our room , the general condition of the building , the category of the Hotel and the overall impression would make you expect a price of 80 to120 Euro according to my experience in South Europe . We payed 195 Euro per night !!! But if you want to go to Rome get ready to be ripped off by the Rome Hotels . Perhaps I will go back to Due Torri next time , but I will try to find a better value for my money first .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Troy01
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from seven nights in Rome and our stay at the Hotel Due Torri was, for the most part, pleasant with few surprises. The main attraction of this hotel is its central location within Old Rome. You can easily walk to most attractions such as the Vatican, Plaza Navona, and the Pantheon. The actual "front door" of the hotel did cause us some concern because it fronts on to a very narrow alley adjacent to a car repair shop. The alley is so narrow that our taxi could not drop us off (or pick us up) and we had to haul our luggage over the cobblestone street to the front door. The alley does, however, appear to be just the right size for the motorcycles and scooters that occasionally roar through in the middle of the night. The alley is dimly lit at night with few people walking about and the overall effect is quite foreboding. It is not a welcoming enviroment by any stretch of the imagination. We rented two rooms on the first floor which probably didn't help with the noise issues. The views from the rooms were nonexistent because of the 5-6 story buildings surrounding the hotel. We rented one queen bed room and one twin bed room and they were adequately sized for European hotels and generally comfortable. From our conversation with the other hotel guests, we may have been on the least favourable floor of the hotel. The upper floor rooms apparently were larger with better accomodations. The hotel website claims they have a upper level view terrace for use by their guests that is actually large enough for 4 people to stand and look around to the adjacent buildings. Most of the staff was pleasant but seemed to lack any knowledge of Rome outside of how to get to Vatican, Spanish Steps,etc. They had no idea where the currency exchange offices were located, when the banks were open, where the Metro subway stations were located, and were generally not interested in helping you find this type of information. A few of the front office staff could almost be described as surly. I would probably use this hotel as a "backup" for my next trip to Rome, but I'm sure there are better hotels that are available for price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a small hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: washall
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children stayed at Due Torri in a quad room for two nights and were very pleased. The hotel staff were really wonderful from booking to getting us checked in early, making restaurant recommendations, getting us geographgicly oriented, calling taxis, helping us with a stuck lock on our luggage and so on. Our room was pretty large for Rome and the price was very reasonable. I will say that the shower was tiny, but all things considered it certainly wasn't a deal breaker. The suite was very clean and our towels were fluffy! The furnishings were very nice and our window opened out into a quite little alley. Our location was convenient for us and we were able to walk to most places. Breakfast was really delicious and the lady who oversaw it made sure that everything was replinished and she made excellent coffee. There was a wide assortment of breakfast foods to choose from...quiches, cereal, yogurt, fruit, boiled eggs, pastries, bread, cheese, crackers, juices, milk...everyone in my picky family found something to eat that they liked! I would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend Hotel Due Torri to anyone regardless of their budget constaints (or not).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Due Torri is a great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Elizabean8
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at the Due Torri in early May when Rome was overloaded with tourists. This hotel may not be in the middle of the action , but it was totally quiet. Since there were no restaurants etc nearby there were no early morning garbage details. We were awakened about 7:30 by a watch dog who welcomed the garage owner each am, but we were ready to arise anyway. The breakfasts werre the best I have ever had in a European hotel,, and most of the employees were friendly and helpful. If needed they are willing to make reservations -- ie. The Bourghese Museum.

Reviews.Title: “good or bad?? can't decide”
Reviews.Author: clv129
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Due Torre for 2 days--then went to Sorrento for 3 days-- then back to the Due Torre for 6 days... During the first stay, we had a room on the 5th floor with a balcony that we were able to hang our washed clothes out... the bathrooms were small with a drainage problem. Our traveling partners had a room on the 5th floor with a balcony that they accessed through the bathroom. Our room was bigger. On our return, we were put on the 3rd floor with no balcony-- we overlooked the auto shop so it was quite noisy with cars/scooters going in and out. The room was very small and the shower (again) had a drainage problem. The location was great for sightseeing--but we had trouble finding the hotel everytime we left it!! the day and late night desk clerks were very helpful, but the early evening desk clerk was less than helpful and not cheerful at all. The breakfast was more than we expected and the woman who manages the kitchen is very sweet. If we go back to Rome, I think we will take our chances at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just how small are the single rooms at the due torri?”
Reviews.Author: marcusandgriffin
Reviews.Content: Think NYC galley kitchen, college dorm room (the bed is some sort of dorm type bed - not even a real single bed), monastic cell, east village apt. My room was probably 5 by 10. Having said that, my 3 night stay was perfectly pleasant, the room was clean, the staff were very nice, they recc'd two really good non-touristy places to eat, the breakfast was fine AND for 118 E per night right in the middle of the centro storico it is a good deal. In other words, if you want to save your $$ for shopping & eating and want to be within walking distance to the Vatican, the Colliseo, the Fora Romana, Piazza Espagna, etc. etc. the Due Torri may be just what you are looking for. By the end, I didn't really mind what an Italian friend called "your little box." (The double rooms look like they are a better size).

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lndylu
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Due Torri. We had a triple which was a suite with two rooms a double in one and a single in the other. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the a/c works wonderfully. The hotel is located close to many attractions however is a little difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, small, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kilometer
Reviews.Content: Within walking distace of all historical sites, we enjoyed with small hotel last week for 2 nights. Rooms and bath also small, comfortable and clean. Super location.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sellaronda
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Due Torri for 3 nights (Friday to Sunday) in October, 2005. There were 6 people in our group and we had 3 rooms, all on the 3rd floor. First of all, the hotel is in a fantastic location in the center of Rome. It really gives you a feel of an older Rome with narrow streets within walking distance of everything you need. We walked everywhere--from the Vatican to the Colosseum without problem. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Piazza Navona and the Pantheon with so many great restaurants and gelato. The hotel is on a very small street. We were picked up by Stefano Constantini (highly recommended for transportation in Rome) who found the hotel without any problem. The van was unable to turn onto the hotel's street, so we had a 75 yard walk to the entrance. We noticed very little traffic on the street during our stay. Any car or scooter that did drive through the street did cause some echoing noise, but the windows were effective in cutting down the noise to a low level. There is an elevator for all except the top floor. The rooms are small, but no different than most rooms in Italy. I would assume the rooms are similar on all floors (except the top floor which have balconies). We had rooms 302, 303, and 305. Rooms 302 and 303 are located right over the entrance to the hotel and are similar. These rooms had queen beds with a table at the foot of the bed and 2 bedside tables. There is a TV with CNN. Room 302 had a small closet. The bathroom is small, but functional. Ok water pressure. Room 305 was a little larger with an armoir and 2 sitting chairs. There is an automated wakeup call system that always worked. Breakfast was basic, but had fresh rolls and pastries, granola, cereals, yoghurt, hardboiled eggs, coffee, cheese, and jams. There was also fresh orange juice available. Overall, I would say it was above average compared to most places in Italy. The staff at the front desk spoke english, helped us call taxis and helped us locate stores we were interested in. There was no discount for paying cash verses credit card. Overall we enjoyed the experience as the hotel was clean, quiet, and had helpful staff. It is a good 2 star hotel with a fantastic location (thus its rather high price) that I would definitely go back to stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I'm ambivalent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel due Torri for 5 nights. The room was perfectly adequate and quite clean, but very small. The common rooms are nice, but the breakfast was a little sub-par I thought -- no cold cuts and cheese to go with our rolls. The staff was not particularly helpful or friendly, and the tiny street is very noisy, as described elsewhere. When we had the window closed, most of the street noise was muffled. But the bathrooms are also quite noisy, and you can hear anyone above you flush their toilet. I was a little disappointed after a great stay in Florence, so maybe I was just spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JNJ
Reviews.Content: Our three generation family of thirteen stayed in the lovely hotel Due Torri in Rome for two nights in July 2005. This is a small, quiet hotel of 26 rooms in a central location only a five minute walk to the Piazza Navonna and fifteen minutes to the Vatican. The rooms are attractively furnished and well sized by European standards. The staff are most accomodating and all speak excellent English. We had several rooms of several different sizes and prices. A standard double was 190 Euro and, for Rome, a real bargain. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Due Torri”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Due Torri in January, 2005, for one week It is right in the middle of the historic district and within walking distance of many restaurants and historic sites. The rooms are small but clean and charming. The bathroom was small but certainly adequate. The breakfast was great and the staff were very helpful. The next time I go to Rome I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “location plus-minus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based substantially on these reviews, we chose Due Torri for our 4 nights in Rome, but despite pleasant interior and helpful staff, it was not our favorite hotel, largely because of the location. It's set back on such a small sidestreet that our Limoservicerome wagon could not get closer than the end of the street and we had to drag our luggage to the entrance. You'd think that would mean a quiet location, but motor scooters roar down the street as a get-through all day and night, and they are particularly loud in the morning when the scooter-repair shop next door opens for business. We were in rooms over the front door and it's possible rooms at the other end of the building would be quieter, but things do echo in those small, dark streets. The location from the point of view of proximity to things IS quite good, however, once you get your bearings and realize how easy it is to get just about anywhere. Another comment: you may not be able to rely on restaurant recommendations from the owner or staff -- they seem to have a "friendly" relationship" with places that were too expensive and not that good. Breakfast was fair to good, bathrooms reasonable for Rome, decor very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelkids
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, you can walk practically everywhere from here. Small but very clean, quiet and charming. Breakfast is fine. I stayed here twice and would highly recommended. As long as you are not looking for luxury and added comforts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value-”
Reviews.Author: shellm
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 or 5 star hotel but they do not pretend to be. The location helps create it's charm on a quiet little street that forces you to walk the short distance to Piazza Navonna and Pantheon areas. The desk was always friendly and sent us to good restaurants that were not a fortune. The breakfast was fine, not excellent. The rooms were small but nicely appointed. In general, very charming and comfortable. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: laughingsquirrel
Reviews.Content: We were so happy after weeks of planning to finally arrive at Hotel Due Torri and find it to be charming, clean, professional, in an absolutely perfect location, and so picturesque. We stayed here for 4 nights--don't miss the restaurant alfredo around the corner, where they cook fettuccini alfredo (supposedly invented there and ten times better than what you would have in the U.S.) at your table in front of you. We loved the breakfast in the morning, with the separate coffee bar where our coffee was made to order. The concierge was also very helpful. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and quiet”
Reviews.Author: WestonT
Reviews.Content: A charming, small place tucked away on a QUIET street. Our room was on the top floor with a narrow rooftop patio area. Had nice views over the rooftops of Rome. Small room with a low ceiling and good AC unit = great climate control during the hot spell! Bathroom was modern and larger than expected, given cramped room. Very good breakfast included. Friendly, helpful staff. Got an excellent shave and haircut from neighborhood barber.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Phantom2
Reviews.Content: For us on our first trip to Rome, this place was perfect. Room was small, but exceptionally clean. Small shower, but bathroom itself a good size and well lit. Payed the same for a lot less in NYC. Key to us was location and staff, worth the price. Did not get on a bus or take a cab while there. Walked to Vatican, 20 min;Spanish steps, 15 min; Pantheon, Trevi , Piazza Navona, 10 min-15 min; Forum/ Colosseum area 25 min. All great "walks" Staff , day and night , was extremely helpful and gracious. Lastly, for us, a delightful breakfast... hard boiled eggs, variety of cereal, juices,croisssants, etc. First timer hint...check out the Pantheon piazza at night. Had to stroll by there everynite. Cool. FYI..from Rome , went to Florence, stayed at Hotel Porta Faenza, will report on that one also. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Decent mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_Jen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Due Torri was my first accommodation in Rome during my trip in Feb. 2004. Although I had read the reviews about the smallness of the rooms, I was still surprised about just how small a room can be. I was in a single and my first room had about a foot of room to walk/maneuver. I enquired if there was anything a bit larger and I was cheerfully moved - to a room that had a spec more space. Besides that, the location of the Due Torri is fabulous - very centrally located and within walking distance of almost everything. The staff is friendly and the rooms clean. My only disappointment is that I was still directed to the 'tourist' restaurants when I stated I wanted to stay away from these. Hotel due Torri is good accommodation for the cost. However, if you can spend a bit more money, the Hotel Locarno was a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “one of the nicest hotels we stayed at”
Reviews.Author: lkylie23
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival in Rome, our first couple of nights were spent in another hotel which was pretty grim, so when an Italian friend suggested Due Torri for our last night in Rome, we took her up on the suggestion. This was such a lovely place! The front desk people were welcoming and helpful, The view of rooftops from our window was charming, and despite other reviews about how small the rooms were, I've seen much worse... try New York City! The location is the main thing though; you really can walk to most sights, and there are some great, reasonably priced restaurants nearby. I'd stay here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Due Torri
HotelInfo.Address: Vicolo del Leonetto, 23, 00186 Rome, Italy
